text:
After build a Chinese webpage by Dreamwaver( Chinese vision), I can see DOC at 
local,But after send DOC to server, The encode is in (ISO)
I did at a line at header of DOC, set encode to gb2312. and it display at local 
very well. I ftp the file to geocities at yahoo, it display ok too.

but why not working at my REDHAT 8.0 server. I had to reset IE at 
view-code-change to gb2312, then I can see the DOC.

Under Win2K Chinese vision. I used notepad build a html file.
there are 4 option for encode. one is gb2312, UTF-8 , ANSI, only file save as 
UTF-8 give me right result. (<meta http-equiv="Content-Type" 
content="text/html; charset=utf-8"> was added at every file.)
however I check IE, it is using gb2312 to decode!

the file build by CGI works OK too.

sample ( this two page is not cgi files)
 http://199.212.79.128/t/ansi.html error
 http://199.212.79.128/t/utf8.htm   OK

Ehm. You need to tell your server, to send the appropriate HTTP headers for the
files (AddCharset). But this is a configuration issue not a bug. Please ask in a
user support list or newsgroup how to conigure the httpd.

Thanks for using Apache.
